ssGUI::​Extensions
namespace
ssGUI::​Extensions
MaskEnforcer
public
Extension
MaskEnforcer

This extension masks the container by calling Mask::MaskObject that is linked to this extension.  Normally you should not add this extension manually. You should manage objects to be masked via Mask.

Variables & Constructor
private:
    std::set<ssGUIObjectIndex> TargetMasks;
    ssGUI::GUIObject* Container;
    bool Enabled;
    bool BlockingContainerInput;

    ObjectsReferences CurrentObjectsReferences;
MaskEnforcer::MaskEnforcer() : TargetMasks(), Container(nullptr), Enabled(true), BlockingContainerInput(false), CurrentObjectsReferences()
{}
Functions
AddTargetMaskObject
virtual void AddTargetMaskObject(
ssGUI::GUIObject* targetMaskObj
)

Add a Mask extension to mask this object. targetMaskObj should have Mask attached.

HasTargetMaskObject
virtual bool HasTargetMaskObject(
ssGUI::GUIObject* targetMaskObj
)

Returns true if targetMaskObj is added to this extension

RemoveTargetMaskObject
virtual void RemoveTargetMaskObject(
ssGUI::GUIObject* targetMaskObj
)

Removes targetMaskObj from this extension

GetTargetMaskObjects
virtual std::vector<ssGUI::GUIObject*> GetTargetMaskObjects()

Returns a list of target mask objects
